pullRequest.title: [DOCS] Adds a paragraph about language identification to the inference conceptual docs
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR adds a short description of language identification with a link to the inference conceptual docs.
Preview: http://stack-docs_830.docs-preview.app.elstc.co/guide/en/machine-learning/master/ml-inference.html

commit.message: [DOCS] Adds a paragraph about language identification to the inference conceptual docs.

nodes.bodyText:
I should know this, but I figure since it's not obvious to me perhaps it won't be obvious to our users either.  Isn't this pre-trained model just a ready-made version of the models described in the "trained models as functions" section? If so, I think this paragraph should just be merged into that section.  For example:

Alternatively, you can use a pre-trained language identification model...
